intro: Aspidosperma acreanum, commonly known as the Brazilian angel's trumpet, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant produces a milky sap that contains various alkaloids, some of which have medicinal properties. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Its ecological importance includes providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain wildlife.
